quizDescription: Test your knowledge about the Consumer-to-Business (C2B) model and its significance in the business world!

questions.question: What does C2B stand for in the business context?
questions.explanation: C2B stands for Consumer-to-Business, where individual consumers offer products or services to businesses.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of the C2B model?
options: A company purchasing software from a vendor
A consumer selling handmade crafts to an online marketplace
A business consulting firm providing services to other businesses
A manufacturer selling products to retail stores
questions.answer: A consumer selling handmade crafts to an online marketplace
questions.explanation: A consumer selling handmade crafts to an online marketplace is an example of the C2B model, where an individual consumer offers products or services to businesses or a marketplace.

questions.question: What is the primary role of consumers in the C2B model?
options: To offer products or services to businesses
To provide feedback and reviews for businesses
questions.answer: To offer products or services to businesses
questions.explanation: In the C2B model, the primary role of consumers is to offer products or services to businesses. Consumers act as suppliers or service providers to fulfill business needs.

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential advantage of the C2B model for businesses?
options: Access to a wider range of products and services
Higher profit margins on consumer offerings
questions.answer: Access to a wider range of products and services
questions.explanation: The C2B model can provide businesses with access to a wider range of products and services offered by individual consumers, allowing businesses to find unique offerings that align with their needs.

questions.question: Which type of platform is commonly used in the C2B model for consumer offerings?
questions.explanation: Business-to-Consumer (B2C) marketplaces are commonly used platforms in the C2B model. These marketplaces connect individual consumers with businesses looking for consumer offerings.
